DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Edisson Sávio is graduated in Mechanical Engineering by the Pernambuco Federal University (UFPE) (1987-1992), Master degree in Nuclear Energetic Technologies by the Pernambuco Federal University (UFPE) (1994-1995), Doctor degree in Mechanical and Aeronautical Engineering by the Aeronautical Technological Institute (ITA) (1996-2002) and Post-Doctor degree in Aerospace Engineering by the Aeronautical Technological Institute (ITA) (2008-2009). He is expert in Aerospace Engineering, with enphasis in centered and upwind numerical methods of high resolution, acting mainly in the following themes: finite volumes and finite differences, centered and upwind schemes, Euler and Navier-Stokes equations, structured and unstructured algorithms, artificial dissipation models, two- and three-dimension spaces, flux difference splitting schemes and flux vector splitting schemes, zero-order turbulence models, one-equation and two-equation turbulence models, TVD and ENO schemes, reactive schemes, entry flows in other planet atmospheres and reentry flows in Earth atmosphere, flowfields submitted to magnetic field. To more details about the production of this researcher, see the homepage http://edissonsavio.wixsite.com/academiclife.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduation at Engenharia Mecânica from Universidade Federal de Pernambuco (1992), master's at Nuclear Engineering from Universidade Federal de Pernambuco (1995) and doctorate at Aerospace Engineering from Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica (2002). Has experience in Aerospace Engineering, acting on the following subjects: euler and navier-stokes equations, finite volumes, three-dimensional space, structured algorithm and two-dimensional space.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Bolsista DCR/Nível 1F realizando pesquisa com simulações de escoamentos tridimensionais resolvendo as equações de Navier-Stokes. São utilizadas técnicas de dinâmica dos fluidos computacional aplicadas à engenharia aeroespacial. Desenvolvimento de "softwares" para aplicação em problemas aeronáuticos e aeroespaciais. O trabalho é continuação do projeto de doutorado do bolsista, terminado em 2002.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Study Techniques of Convergence Acceleration to Steady State Problems
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: To implement convergence acceleration techniques to the 2D and 3D spaces like: spatially variable time step, implicit residual smoothing, enthalpy damping, Multigrid and increase of the CFL number with the number of iterations. This implementation is performed as on structured as on unstructured contexts.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Study with Upwind High Resolution Algorithms
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: To study upwind high resolution algorithms to capture accurately shock waves without the need of more refined meshes. This work is performed as in the structured spatial context as in the unstructured spatial context. In the structured context, the MUSCL, ENO and WENO procedures are analyzed to produce high resolution. A Newton reconstruction or Hermite reconstruction are employed. In the unstructured context, the linear reconstruction procedure of Barth and Jespersen (1989) is studied.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Desenvolvimento de Programas (Software) e Prestação de Serviços em Informática

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Trabalhando como Professor Temporário e Realizando Atividades de Pesquisa em Dinâmica dos Fluidos Computacional (CFD). Realizando atividades de pesquisa com simulação de escoamentos de entrada na atmosfera de Marte e de reentrada na atmosfera da Terra. Consideradas simulações não viscosas e viscosas, discretização espacial estruturada e não estruturada, nos espaços 2D e 3D. Códigos computacionais desenvolvidos a partir de 2008.
VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-INGLES: Trabalhando como Professor Temporário e Realizando Atividades de Pesquisa em Dinâmica dos Fluidos Computacional (CFD).

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Simulation of Entry Flows in the Mars Atmosphere and of Reentry Flows in the Earth Atmosphere, Structured and Unstructured, 2D and 3D
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: To study reactive flows of entry in the Mars atmosphere and of reentry in the Earth atmosphere. Models of five species, in chemical non-equilibrium, of seven species in thermochemical non-equilibrium, of nine species in thermochemical non-equilibrium (Mars) and of eleven species in thermochemical non-equilibrium are studied. The Van Leer (1982) and the Liou and Steffen Jr. (1993) schemes are employed to perform the numerical experiments. Seven methods to march in time are studied. Structured and unstructured spatial discretizations, in 2D and 3D, are considered.
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: Simulação de Escoamentos de Entrada na Atmosfera de Marte e de Reentrada na Atmosfera de Marte, Estruturado e Não Estruturado, 2D e 3D
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: Estudar escoamentos reativos de entrada na atmosfera de Marte e de reentrada na atmosfera da Terra. São estudados modelos de cinco (5) espécies, em equilíbrio térmico e não equilíbrio químico, de sete (7) espécies em não equilíbrio termoquímico, de nove (9) espécies em não equilíbrio termoquímico (Marte), e de onze (11) espécies em não equilíbrio termoquímico. São utilizados os esquemas de Van Leer (1982) e de Liou e Steffen Jr. (1993). Sete (7) esquemas para marcha no tempo são estudados. Discretização espacial estruturada e não estruturada, em 2D e 3D.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-3: Outras atividades profissionais, científicas e técnicas

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Study of Several Artificial Dissipation Models in Finite Volumes, 2D and 3D (Isotropics and Anisotropics)
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: To study structured artificial dissipation models in 2D and 3D, applied to symmetrical schemes and aerospace problems.Non-linear, isotropic and anisotropic models are studied. The tested models are of: MacCormack and Baldwin (1975), Mavriplis (1990), Azevedo (1992), Turkel and Vatsa (1994) / Scalar, and Turkel and Vatsa (1994) / Matricial. The employed formulation is of finite volumes.
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: Estudo de Vários Modelos de Dissipação Artificial em Volumes Finitos, 2D e 3D (Isotrópicos e Anisotrópicos)
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: Estudar modelos de dissipação artificial estruturados em 2D e 3D, aplicados a esquemas simétricos e problemas aeroespaciais. São estudados modelos não lineares, isotrópicos e anisotrópicos. Os modelos estudados são os de: MacCormack e Baldwin (1975), Mavriplis (1990), Azevedo (1992), Turkel e Vatsa (1994) / Escalar, e Turkel e Vatsa (1994) / Matricial. A formulação empregada é a de volumes finitos.

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-5: Turkel and Vatsa (1994) matrix dissipation model

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Study of Turbulence Models Applied to Unstructured Spatial Discretization in 2D
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: To study turbulence models applied to aerospace problems, employing unstructured spatial discretization, in the two-dimensional space. The studied turbulence models are of: Wilcox and Rubesin (1980), Wilcox (1988), Menter and Rumsey (1994), Yoder, Georgiadids and Orkwis (1995), Coakley (1997), and Ying, Rumsey, Gatski and Bertelrud (1998). All models are k-w or k-w2. These studies aim the future implementation of such models according to a reactive formulation.
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: Estudo de Modelos de Turbulência Aplicados a Discretização Espacial Não Estruturada em 2D
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: Estudar modelos de turbulência aplicados a problemas aeroespaciais, utilizando discretização espacial não estruturada, no espaço 2D. São estudados os modelos de Wilcox e Rubesin (1980), Wilcox (1988), Menter e Rumsey (1994), Yoder, Georgiadids e Orkwis (1995), Coakley (1997), e Ying et al. (1998). Todos modelos k-w ou k-w2. Estes estudos visam futura implementação de tais modelos segundo uma formulação reativa.

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-4: Modelo de Yoder, Georgiadis e Orkwis (1995)

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Study of TVD and ENO Schemes Applied to Structured Spatial Discretization in 2D and 3D
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: To study TVD and ENO schemes applied to aerospace problems. Initially is treated the structured spatial discretization in explicit and implicit formulations. The studied algorithms are of: Harten and Osher (1987), Yang (1990), Yang (1991), and Yang and Hsu (1992). Two- and three-dimensional problems are studied.
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: Estudo de Esquemas TVD e ENO Aplicados a Discretização Espacial Estruturada em 2D e 3D
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: Estudar esquemas TVD e ENO aplicados a problemas aeroespaciais. Inicialmente será tratada a discretização espacial estruturada em formulações explícita e implícita. Os algoritmos estudados são os de: Harten e Osher (1987), Yang (1990), Yang (1991) e Yang e Hsu (1992). Serão estudados problemas em 2D e 3D.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Simulation of Flowfields Submitted to Magnetic Fields in 2D and 3D
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: To study flowfields in 2D and 3D submitted to a magnetic field actuation. The Maxwell equations are solved by the MacCormack (1969) and by the Jameson and Mavriplis (1986) algorithms, according to structured and unstructured spatial discretizations. The Maxwell equations are solved coupled with the Euler and Navier-Stokes equations.
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.TITULO-DA-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: Simulação de Escoamentos Submetidos a Campos Magnéticos em 2D e 3D
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: Estudar escoamentos 2D e 3D submetidos a atuação de um campo magnético. São utilizadas as equações de Maxwell resolvidas pelos algoritmos de MacCormack (1969) e de Jameson e Mavriplis (1986), segundo discretizações espaciais estruturadas e não estruturadas. As equações de Maxwell são resolvidas acopladas com as equações de Euler ou Navier-Stokes.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Segurança, Localização e Licenciamento de Reatores

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this paper, the matricial formalism of the perturbation theory is applied in a simplified model to study the hot channel of PWR reactors. Mass, linear momentum and energy conservation equations and appropriated heat transfer and fluid mechanic correlations describe the discretized system. After calculating system's thermalhydraulic properties, the matricial formalism is applied and the sensitivity coeficients are determined for each case of interest. Comparisons between perturbative method and direct results of the model have shown good agreement which demonstrates that the matricial formalism is an important tool for discretized system analysis.

MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The paper presents comparisons between different algorithms used for the solution of the Euler equations for typical aerospace applications. The schemes considered include a cell centered, unstructured, explicit method and an implicit, unfactored algorithm constructed on structured grids. The unstructured method is based on Jameson and Mavriplis' work and it yields a centered, spatially 2nd-order scheme. The structured algorithm is based on MacCormack's flux vector splitting scheme, but it is only 1st-order accurate in space. The particular applications considered were the transonic nozzle flows and supersonic blunt body flows. The aspects emphasized in the present comparison were the final solution quality for steady state applications, the overall easiness of code implementation, and the method's computational efficiency.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O presente trabalho aplica as equações de Navier-Stokes com média de Reynolds aos problemas dos escoamentos transônicos em um bocal convergente-divergente e em um aerofólio NACA 0012. O modelo de Baldwin e Lomax é utilizado para descrever os efeitos da turbulência nas propriedades do escoamento. Três algoritmos são usados: o esquema explícito de MacCormack; o esquema de Pulliam e Chaussee; e o esquema de Jameson, Schmidt e Turkel. Os resultados obtidos pelos esquemas apresentam boa comparação para os casos laminar e turbulento. No problema do aerofólio, os coeficientes aerodinâmicos têm seus valores maximizados no caso turbulento. No geral, os esquemas de MacCormack e Jameson, Schmidt e Turkel apresentam soluções melhores.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the XVIII International Congress of Mechanical Engineering (XVIII COBEM)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work performs a comparison between a centered numerical scheme and a high resolution upwind scheme. The Jameson and Mavriplis algorithm, on the context of a centered spatial discretization and second order spatial accuracy, and the Frink, Parikh and Pirzadeh algorithm, on the context of upwind spatial discretization, using a flux difference splitting formulation and first order spatial accuracy, both explicit in time, are studied. The Jameson and Mavriplis algorithm uses an artificial dissipation operator to guarantee numerical stability. The Euler equations in conservative form, using a finite volume formulation and an unstructured spatial discretization of the flow equations, in two-dimensions, are solved. The transonic flow around a NACA 0012 airfoil and the supersonic flow around a simplified configuration of VLS are physical problems studied in this work. Both problems are studied in steady state regime and a zero angle of attack is adopted. The time integration uses a Runge-Kutta time stepping method of five stages and second order of accuracy. Results have shown good agreement between the algorithms with better solution quality characteristics and convergence acceleration properties to the Jameson and Mavriplis scheme.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: ANALYSIS OF CONVERGENCE ACCELERATION TECHNIQUES USED IN UNSTRUCTURED ALGORITHMS IN THE SOLUTION OF AERONAUTICAL PROBLEMS - PART I

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the XVIII International Congress of Mechanical Engineering (XVIII COBEM)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work intends to study convergence accelerating techniques applied to the solution of steady state problems. Techniques like spatially variable time step, implicit residual smoothing, enthalpy damping and increase of the CFL number during iteractive process are studied. The Jameson and Mavriplis explicit algorithm, with centered spatial discretization and the artificial dissipation operator of Mavriplis, was implemented to perform the two-dimensional numerical experiments. This scheme is second order accurate in space. The Euler equations in conservative form, employing a finite volume formulation and an unstructured spatial discretization are solved. The techniques were studied and compared with themselves in the solution of the physical problem of the transonic flow around a NACA 0012 airfoil, with zero angle of attack. The employed time march was the Runge-Kutta method of five stages and second order. The results have shown that the best technique studied was enthalpy damping, having better convergence gain than the others and have moderate computational cost. A final analysis of the technique computational performances is accomplished at the end (cost, maximum CFL number and iterations to convergence).

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: SOLUTION OF THE EULER EQUATIONS IN THE THREE-DIMENSIONAL SPACE USING THE MACCORMACK ALGORITHM - PART I

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XVIII International Congress of Mechanical Engineering (XVIII COBEM)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the XVIII International Congress of Mechanical Engineering (XVIII COBEM)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work studies the MacCormack algorithm applied to the solution of the Euler equations in three-dimensional space, solving aerospace problems. A finite volume formulation is used, as also a cell centered data structure and structured spatial discretization of the flow equations. The scheme is second order accurate in space and time. The time integration uses a predictor-corrector scheme with a forward spatial discretization in the predictor step and a backward spatial discretization in the corrector step. An artificial dissipation operator based on the Azevedo work is implemented to guarantee scheme numerical stability in the presence of shock waves and background instabilities. A spatially variable time step is implemented to accelerate the convergence process to the steady state solution. The physical problems of the supersonic flow along a ramp and of the "cold gas" hypersonic flow along a diffuser are studied. In the ramp problem the shock wave is well detected and in the diffuser problem the shock interference is well solved. A final analysis of the computational performance (cost, maximum CFL number and iterations to convergence) is accomplished. The importance of this work is to describe numerical tools that can be used to solve the steady state flowfield of physical problems of interest in the aeronautical and aerospace industry. In this work, the MacCormack algorithm is presented and some results are presented that can be used as reference results to the CFD community.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: SOLUTION OF THE NAVIER-STOKES EQUATIONS IN THE THREE-DIMENSIONAL SPACE USING THE MACCORMACK ALGORITHM - PARTE II

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work studies the MacCormack algorithm applied to the solution of the Navier-Stokes equations in the three-dimensional space, solving aerospace problems. A finite volume formulation is used, as also a cell centered data structure and a structured spatial discretization. The scheme is second order accurate in space and time. The time integration uses a predictor-corrector method with forward spatial discretization in the predictor step and backward spatial discretization in the corrector step. An artificial dissipation operator based on Azevedo work is implemented to guarantee the scheme numerical stability in the presence of shock waves and background instabilities. A spatially variable time step is implemented aiming to accelerate the convergence process to the steady state solution. The physical problems of the supersonic flow along a ramp and of the "cold gas" hypersonic flow along a diffuser are solved. The results have demonstrated good description of the flow fields. In the ramp problem the shock is well detected and in the diffuser problem the shock interference is well solved. A final analysis of the computational performance (cost, maximum CFL number and iterations to convergence) is accomplished.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work presents the Jameson and Mavriplis algorithm applied to the solution of the Euler equations in three-dimensions, solving aerospace problems. A finite volume formulation is used, as also a cell centered data base and a structured spatial discretization. The scheme is second order accurate in space and time. The time integration uses a Runge-Kutta method of five stages. An artificial dissipation operator based on Azevedo work is implemented to guarantee numerical stability in presence of shock waves and of background instabilities. A spatially variable time step is implemented aiming to accelerate the convergence process to the steady state solution. The physical problems of the supersonic flow along a ramp and the "cold gas" hypersonic flow along a diffuser are solved. In the ramp problem the shock is well detected and in the diffuser problem the shock interference is well solved. A final analysis of the computational performance ( maximum CFL number and iterations to convergence) is accomplished.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work presents the Jameson and Mavriplis algorithm applied to the solution of the Navier-Stokes equations in three-dimensions, solving aerospace problems. A finite volume formulation is used, with a cell centered data base and using a structured spatial discretization. The scheme is second order accurate in space and time. The time integration uses a Runge-Kutta method of five stages. An artificial dissipation operator based on Azevedo work is implemented to guarantee numerical stability in the presence of shock waves and background instability. A spatially variable time step is implemented aiming to accelerate the convergence process to steady state solution. The physical problems of the supersonic flow along a ramp and of the "cold gas" hypersonic flow along a diffuser are solved. In the ramp problem the shock is well detected and in the diffuser problem the shock interference is well solved. A final analysis of the computational performance (maximum CFL number and iterations to convergence) is accomplished.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: High Resolution Algorithms Coupled with Three Turbulence Models Applied to an Aerospace Flow Problem - Part I

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Nide Geraldo do Couto Ramos Fico Júnior
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: FICO JÚNIOR, Nide Geraldo Do Couto Ramos

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-5: Radespiel and Kroll Flux Vector Splitting Algorith

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work deals with high resolution algorithms for the solution of an aerospace flow problem. The Navier-Stokes equations written in conservative form, employing a finite volume formulation and a structured spatial discretization, in two-dimensions, are solved. The Harten and the Radespiel and Kroll algorithms, both first order accurate in space, are studied. Turbulence is taken into account using different models, namely: the Cebeci and Smith, the Baldwin and Lomax and the Sparlat and Allmaras models. The steady state supersonic flow around a simplified version of the Brazilian Satellite Launcher, VLS, configuration is studied. The results have shown good agreement among the algorithms tested. The-Cp distribution generated by the Harten scheme, in both solutions laminar and turbulent, for all turbulence models, is smoother than for the one obtained by the Radespiel and Kroll scheme, presenting a minor pressure increase in the booster initial region. The lift and drag aerodynamic coefficients, for the turbulent solution generated by the Harten scheme, presented non-zero values. The Radespiel and Kroll scheme predicts coefficients values practically equal to zero, in the laminar case, and with small values for the turbulent case. The angle of attack was adopted equal to zero. Finally, an analysis of the computational performance (cost, maximum number of CFL and iterations to convergence) is also carried out.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: ESTUDOS DE ESCOAMENTOS TURBULENTOS UTILIZANDO OS MODELOS DE CEBECI E SMITH E DE BALDWIN E LOMAX E COMPARAÇÃO ENTRE OS ALGORITMOS DE MACCORMACK E DE JAMESON E MAVRIPLIS

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: VII Simpósio de Mecânica Computacional (VII SIMMEC)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do VII Simpósio de Mecânica Computacional (VII SIMMEC)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-4: Modelo Algébrico de Cebeci e Smith
PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-5: Modelo Algébrico de Baldwin e Lomax

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O presente trabalho estuda os algoritmos de MacCormack e de Jameson e Mavriplis aplicados ao problema de estado estacionário do escoamento supersônico ao longo de uma rampa. Ambos os esquemas são de segunda ordem de precisão no espaço e no tempo. O esquema de MacCormack é um esquema tipo Lax-Wendroff e realiza a integração temporal em conjunto com a discretização espacial. A integração no tempo é do tipo preditor/corretor. O esquema de Jameson e Mavriplis é simétrico e a integração no tempo é segundo um método tipo Runge-Kutta. As equações de Navier-Stokes com média de Reynolds são resolvidas, em uma formulação de volumes finitos e discretização espacial estruturada, e os modelos de Cebeci e Smith e de Baldwin e Lomax são utilizados para descrever os efeitos da turbulência nas propriedades do escoamento. Um passo no tempo variável espacialmente é empregado a fim de acelerar a convergência dos esquemas numéricos. Os resultados demonstraram que o algoritmo de Jameson e Mavriplis prevê um campo de pressão mais severo do que o obtido pelo esquema de MacCormack quando se é estudado o escoamento turbulento, situação mais real, para ambos os modelos. As distribuições de pressão ao longo da rampa obtidas pelos esquemas de MacCormack e de Jameson e Mavriplis apresentam o comportamento esperado na solução turbulenta gerada pelo modelo de Cebeci e Smith, enquanto a solução laminar simula um choque mais fraco antes da rampa. No caso do modelo de Baldwin e Lomax, apenas a solução obtida com o esquema de Jameson e Mavriplis apresenta o comportamento esperado para a distribuição de pressão. No geral, o esquema de Jameson e Mavriplis apresenta soluções melhores.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARAÇÃO ENTRE DIFERENTES MODELOS DE DISSIPAÇÃO ARTIFICIAL APLICADOS A UM SISTEMA DE COORDENADAS GENERALIZADAS - PARTE 1

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: VII Simpósio de Mecânica Computacional (VII SIMMEC)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do VII Simpósio de Mecânica Computacional (VII SIMMEC)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho apresenta quatro modelos de dissipação artificial implementados no algoritmo de fatoração aproximada de Chaussee e Pulliam. Os modelos linear e não linear escalares isotrópicos de Pulliam e os modelos não lineares escalar e matricial anisotrópicos de Turkel e Vatsa são analisados. São resolvidas as equações de Euler no espaço bidimensional, em um contexto de diferenças finitas e em um sistema de coordenadas generalizadas. É estudado o problema físico de estado estacionário do escoamento supersônico ao longo de uma rampa. Um passo no tempo variável espacialmente é empregado a fim de acelerar a convergência do algoritmo de Chaussee e Pulliam. Os testes evidenciaram que o modelo de dissipação artificial anisotrópico não linear escalar de Turkel e Vatsa foi o que apresentou os melhores resultados em relação à qualidade da solução e relação custo-benefício. Este trabalho consiste na primeira etapa para estudos de escoamentos turbulentos utilizando um algoritmo simétrico e diferentes modelos de dissipação artificial. Mais estudos, com outros casos-exemplos, serão estudados por este autor, em um segundo artigo desta série, visando melhor destacar as características destes modelos de dissipação artificial.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARAÇÃO ENTRE OS ALGORITMOS DE ALTA RESOLUÇÃO DE HARTEN E DE RADESPIEL E KROLL NA SOLUÇÃO DAS EQUAÇÕES DE EULER NO ESPAÇO BIDIMENSIONAL - PARTE I

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IV Congresso Nacional de Engenharia Mecânica (IV CONEM)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do IV Congresso Nacional de Engenharia Mecânica (IV CONEM)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O presente trabalho analisa algoritmos assimétricos de alta resolução aplicados à solução de problemas aeronáuticos e aeroespaciais. São estudados os algoritmos de Harten e de Radespiel e Kroll, ambos com primeira ordem de precisão espacial. São resolvidas as equações de Euler em forma conservativa, empregando uma formulação de volumes finitos e discretização espacial estruturada, em duas dimensões. A integração no tempo é realizada pelo método de separação temporal. São estudados os problemas físicos de estado estacionário dos escoamentos supersônicos ao longo de uma rampa e em torno da geometria de um corpo rombudo. No problema da rampa, o algoritmo de Radespiel e Kroll apresentou soluções mais críticas para os campos de pressão e de número de Mach. Ambos os esquemas previram o mesmo valor para o ângulo de choque da onda de choque oblíqüa. No problema do corpo rombudo, novamente o campo de pressão foi mais intenso pela solução gerada pelo esquema de Radespiel e Kroll. Os coeficientes aerodinâmicos de sustentação e de arrasto tiveram melhores estimativas pelo esquema de Radespiel e Kroll, assim como a pressão de estagnação à frente da geometria.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARAÇÃO ENTRE OS ALGORITMOS DE ALTA RESOLUÇÃO DE FRINK, PARIKH E PIRZADEH E DE LIOU E STEFFEN NA SOLUÇÃO DAS EQUAÇÕES DE EULER NO ESPAÇO BIDIMENSIONAL - PARTE I

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IV Congresso Nacional de Engenharia Mecânica (IV CONEM)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do IV Congresso Nacional de Engenharia Mecânica (IV CONEM)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-1: Esquema de Frink, Parikh e Pirzadeh

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O presente trabalho analisa algoritmos assimétricos de alta resolução aplicados à solução de problemas aeronáuticos e aeroespaciais. São estudados os algoritmos de Frink, Parikh e Pirzadeh e de Liou e Steffen, ambos com primeira ordem de precisão espacial. São resolvidas as equações de Euler em forma conservativa, empregando uma formulação de volumes finitos e discretização espacial estruturada, em duas dimensões. A integração no tempo é realizada pelo método de Runge-Kutta e cinco estágios no caso do algoritmo de Frink, Parikh e Pirzadeh e pelo método de separação temporal no caso do algoritmo de Liou e Steffen. São estudados os problemas físicos de estado estacionário dos escoamentos supersônicos ao longo de uma rampa e em torno da geometria de um corpo rombudo. No problema da rampa, o algoritmo de Liou e Steffen apresenta solução mais crítica para o campo de pressão, mas o choque e o leque de expansão são melhores capturados pelo esquema de Frink, Parikh e Pirzadeh. O ângulo do choque é mais bem estimado pelo esquema de Liou e Steffen. No problema do corpo rombudo, o esquema de Liou e Steffen é mais robusto do que o esquema de Frink, Parikh e Pirzadeh, suportando uma condição inicial mais crítica. O campo de pressão é mais intenso pela solução gerada pelo esquema de Liou e Steffen. Os coeficientes aerodinâmicos de sustentação e de arrasto são apropriadamente previstos por ambos os esquemas e a pressão de estagnação à frente da geometria tem melhor previsão pelo esquema de Liou e Steffen.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARAÇÃO ENTRE OS MODELOS DE TURBULÊNCIA DE CEBECI E SMITH E DE BALDWIN E LOMAX

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: V Escola de Primavera de Transição e Turbulência (V EPTT)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais da V Escola de Primavera de Transição e Turbulência (V EPTT)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O presente trabalho visa uma comparação entre os modelos de turbulência de Cebeci e Smith e de Baldwin e Lomax. Os algoritmos de MacCormack e de Jameson e Mavriplis são utilizados para realizar os experimentos numéricos, ambos com segunda ordem de precisão espacial e temporal. O esquema de MacCormack é do tipo preditor/corretor, enquanto o esquema de Jameson e Mavriplis é simétrico. As equações de Navier-Stokes com média de Reynolds, segundo um contexto de volumes finitos e discretização espacial estruturada, são resolvidas. O problema físico do escoamento supersônico ao longo de uma rampa é estudado. Um passo no tempo variável espacialmente é empregado a fim de acelerar a convergência. Quando o esquema de MacCormack é utilizado, o modelo de Cebeci e Smith prevê um campo de pressão mais severo, assim como uma melhor distribuição de pressão ao longo da rampa, do que o modelo de Baldwin e Lomax, que prevê um choque mais fraco antes da rampa. Quando o esquema de Jameson e Mavriplis é empregado, não são percebidas diferenças significativas nos resultados de pressão. A solução laminar apresenta um choque mais fraco antes da rampa, detectado pelos algoritmos, que é eliminado pelo modelo de Cebeci e Smith.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: HIGH RESOLUTION ALGORITHMS COUPLED WITH THE BALDWIN AND LOMAX MODEL APPLIED TO A TURBULENT FLOW PROBLEM

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais da V Escola de Primavera de Transição e Turbulência (V EPTT)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Nide Geraldo do Couto Ramos Fico Júnior
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: FICO JÚNIOR, Nide Geraldo Do Couto Ramos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work deals with high resolution algorithms applied to the solution of an aerospace flow problem. The Harten and the Radespiel and Kroll algorithms, both first order accurate in space, are studied. The Navier-Stokes equations written in conservative form, employing a finite volume formulation and a structured spatial discretization, in two-dimensions, are solved. The Baldwin and Lomax turbulence algebraic model closes the problem. The steady state physical problem of the supersonic flow around a simplified version of the VLS configuration is studied. The -Cp distribution around the geometry generated by the Harten scheme, in both solutions laminar and turbulent, is smoother than to the one obtained by the Radespiel and Kroll scheme, presenting a minor pressure increase in the booster initial region. The lift and drag aerodynamic coefficients are minimized in the turbulent solution generated by the Harten scheme, presenting non-zero values. The Radespiel and Kroll scheme predicts the same coefficients with values practically equal to zero to the laminar case and with small values in the turbulent case. The stagnation pressure ahead of the configuration is better predicted by the Harten scheme.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARISON BETWEEN THE YEE, WARMING AND HARTEN AND THE HUGHSON AND BERAN HIGH RESOLUTION ALGORITHMS IN THE SOLUTION OF THE EULER EQUATIONS IN TWO-DIMENSIONS - RESULTS

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXVII Iberian Latin-American Congress on Computational Methods in Engineering (XXVII CILAMCE)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the XXVII Iberian Latin-American Congress on Computational Methods in Engineering (XXVII CILAMCE)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work is the second part of the study that aims a comparison between the Yee, Warming & Harten and the Hughson & Beran schemes applied to the solution of aeronautical and aerospace problems. Both schemes are TVD and second order accurate in space. The Euler equations in conservative form, employing a finite volume formulation and a structured spatial discretization, are solved in two-dimensions. The time integration is performed by a time splitting method. The physical problems of the transonic flows along a convergent-divergent nozzle and around a NACA 0012 airfoil, the supersonic flows along a ramp and around a blunt body, and the "cold gas" hypersonic flow around a double ellipse are studied. In the airfoil problem, the aerodynamic coefficients are better estimated by the Yee, Warming & Harten scheme, while the Hughson & Beran scheme predicts better values in the blunt body problem. In this problem, the stagnation pressure is better estimated by the later, while in the double ellipse problem the former predicts a better value. In the ramp problem, the shock and the expansion fan are better captured by the Hughson & Beran scheme, as well a better prediction of the shock angle.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARISON BETWEEN THE YEE, WARMING AND HARTEN AND THE HUGHSON AND BERAN HIGH RESOLUTION ALGORITHMS IN THE SOLUTION OF THE EULER EQUATIONS IN TWO-DIMENSIONS - THEORY

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXVII Iberian Latin-American Congress on Computational Methods in Engineering (XXVII CILAMCE)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the XXVII Iberian Latin-American Congress on Computational Methods in Engineering (XXVII CILAMCE)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In the present work, the theory involving the numerical implementation of the Yee, Warming & Harten and of the Hughson & Beran high resolution schemes is developed, aiming the application of these schemes to the solution of aeronautical and aerospace problems of interest in the second paper of this series. Both schemes are of TVD flux difference splitting type and are second order accurate in space. The Euler equations in conservative form, employing a finite volume formulation and structured spatial discretization, in two-dimensions, are presented. The time integration is also described, based on a time splitting technique, first order accurate. A spatially variable time step procedure is presented aiming to accelerate the convergence of the numerical schemes to the steady state solution. The initial and boundary conditions are also discussed aiming to give all tools to the numerical implementation of the tested schemes. The second paper of this series presents the results obtained by these schemes to five different physical problems, namely the transonic flows along a convergent-divergent nozzle and around a NACA 0012 airfoil, the supersonic flows along a ramp and around a blunt body, and the "cold gas" hypersonic flow around a double ellipse.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: HIGH RESOLUTION ALGORITHMS COUPLED WITH THREE TURBULENCE MODELS APPLIED TO AN AEROSPACE FLOW PROBLEM - PART II

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXVII Iberian Latin-American Congress on Computational Methods in Engineering (XXVII CILAMCE)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the XXVII Iberian Latin-American Congress on Computational Methods in Engineering (XXVII CILAMCE)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Nide Geraldo do Couto Ramos Fico Júnior
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: FICO JÚNIOR, Nide Geraldo Do Couto Ramos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work deals with high resolution algorithms for the solution of an aerospace flow problem. The 2-D Navier-Stokes equations written in conservative form, are solved employing a finite volume formulation in a structured grid. The Harten and the Radespiel & Kroll algorithms, both first order accurate in space, are studied. Turbulence is taken into account using different models, namely: the Cebeci & Smith, the Baldwin & Lomax and the Sparlat & Allmaras models. The supersonic flow around a double ellipse configuration is studied. The Radespiel & Kroll scheme presents more severe pressure field and Cp peak at the minor ellipse than the Harten scheme, for both the laminar and turbulent cases. The Cebeci & Smith model predicts the most severe pressure field and Cp peak at the minor ellipse among the tested models. The lift and drag aerodynamic coefficients calculated by the Radespiel & Kroll scheme are more severe than those calculated by the Harten scheme. The stagnation pressure ahead of the configuration is better predicted by the Radespiel & Kroll scheme. For turbulent flows, the Cebeci & Smith model predicts the best value of the stagnation pressure regardless of the selected scheme.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARISON AMONG PREDICTOR-CORRECTOR, SIMMETRICAL AND TVD UPWIND SCHEMES IN THE SOLUTION OF THE EULER EQUATIONS IN TWO-DIMENSIONS - THEORY

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XIX Congress of Mechanical Engineering (XIX COBEM)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the XIX Congress of Mechanical Engineering (XIX COBEM)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Desenvolvimento de Programas (Software) e Prestação de Serviços em Informática

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work compares the MacCormack, the Harten, the Yee and Kutler and the Jameson and Mavriplis numerical methods, using a finite volume formulation and a structured spatial discretization, applied to the solution of the Euler equations in the two-dimensional space. All schemes are second order accurate in space. The MacCormack and the Jameson and Mavriplis schemes are also second order accurate in time and both use artificial dissipation operators to guarantee the convergence to the steady state solution. The steady state physical problems of the transonic flows along a convergent-divergent nozzle and around a NACA 0012 airfoil, the supersonic flow along a ramp and the "cold gas" hypersonic flow around a double ellipse configuration are studied. A spatially variable time step is implemented aiming to accelerate the convergence process. The results have demonstrated that the MacCormack scheme predicts the most critical solutions, although unphysical results were obtained in high Mach numbers. Shock pressure ratio, nozzle, and stagnation pressure, double ellipse, were best estimated by this scheme. This paper is concerned with the theories related to the numerical implementation of the schemes. The part II (RESULTS) presents the solutions and comparisons between numerical and experimental or theoretical results.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARISON AMONG PREDICTOR-CORRECTOR, SIMMETRICAL AND TVD UPWIND SCHEMES IN THE SOLUTION OF THE EULER EQUATIONS IN TWO-DIMENSIONS - RESULTS

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work compares the MacCormack, the Harten, the Yee and Kutler and the Jameson and Mavriplis numerical methods, using a finite volume formulation and a structured spatial discretization, applied to the solution of the Euler equations in the two-dimensional space. All schemes are second order accurate in space. The MacCormack and the Jameson and Mavriplis schemes are also second order accurate in time and both use artificial dissipation operators to guarantee the convergence to the steady state solution. The steady state physical problems of the transonic flows along a convergent-divergent nozzle and around a NACA 0012 airfoil, the supersonic flow along a ramp and the "cold gas" hypersonic flow around a double ellipse configuration are studied. A spatially variable time step is implemented aiming to accelerate the convergence process. The results have demonstrated that the MacCormack scheme predicts the most critical solutions, although unphysical results were obtained in high Mach numbers. Shock pressure ratio, nozzle, and stagnation pressure, double ellipse, were best estimated by this scheme. This paper (RESULTS) presents the solutions of the numerical simulations performed by the schemes, comparisons between numerical and experimental or theoretical results and computational data.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARISON BETWEEN THE FIRST ORDER UPWIND UNSTRUCTURED ALGORITHMS OF STEGER AND WARMING AND OF VAN LEER IN THE SOLUTION OF THE EULER EQUATIONS IN TWO-DIMENSIONS

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Desenvolvimento de Programas (Software) e Prestação de Serviços em Informática

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work performs comparisons between the Steger and Warming and the Van Leer algorithms applied to the solution of aeronautical and of aerospace problems, in two-dimensions. The Euler equations in conservative form, employing a finite volume formulation and an unstructured spatial discretization, are solved. The Steger and Warming and the Van Leer schemes are flux vector splitting ones and good robustness properties are expected. The time integration is performed by a Runge-Kutta method of five stages. Both schemes are first order accurate in space and second order accurate in time. The steady state physical problems of the transonic flow along a convergent-divergent nozzle and of the supersonic flows along a ramp and around a blunt body are studied. In all problems, the value of the entrance or attack angle is considered equal to zero. A spatially variable time step procedure is implemented aiming to accelerate the convergence of the schemes to the steady state condition. The results have demonstrated that the Van Leer scheme presents more severe pressure fields in the ramp and in the blunt body problems, as well more accurate values in the determination of the shock angle, ramp problem, and of the stagnation pressure, blunt body problem, than the Steger and Warming scheme, recommending the former to project calculations.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARISON BETWEEN THE FIRST ORDER UPWIND UNSTRUCTURED ALGORITHMS OF ROE AND OF HARTEN IN THE SOLUTION OF THE EULER EQUATIONS IN TWO-DIMENSIONS

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Desenvolvimento de Programas (Software) e Prestação de Serviços em Informática

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work performs comparisons between the Roe and the Harten algorithms applied to the solution of aeronautical and of aerospace problems, in two-dimensions. The Euler equations in conservative form, employing a finite volume formulation and an unstructured spatial discretization, are solved. Both schemes are flux difference splitting ones and accurate solutions are expected. The time integration is performed by a Runge-Kutta method of five stages. Both schemes are first order accurate in space and second order accurate in time. The steady state physical problems of the transonic flow along a convergent-divergent nozzle and of the supersonic flows along a ramp and around a blunt body are studied. In all problems, the value of the entrance or attack angle is considered equal to zero. A spatially variable time step procedure is implemented aiming to accelerate the convergence of the schemes to the steady state condition. The results have demonstrated that the Roe scheme presents more severe pressure fields in the ramp and blunt body problems and a more accurate value of the stagnation pressure in the blunt body case than the Harten scheme.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARAÇÃO ENTRE VÁRIOS MODELOS DE DISSIPAÇÃO ARTIFICIAL NA SOLUÇÃO DAS EQUAÇÕES DE NAVIER-STOKES

AZEVEDO, João Luiz Filgueiras de

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Desenvolvimento de Programas (Software) e Prestação de Serviços em Informática

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Navier-Stokes equations, written in conservative form, are applied to simulate the flowfield in a two-dimensional convergent-divergent transonic nozzle. A finite difference formulation is used to perform the spatial discretization in a generalized coordinate system. The march in pseudo-time is performed by the implicit Euler method to obtain steady state solutions. Four different types of dissipation models based on isotropism or anisotropism, linearity and nonlinearity characteristics are tested and their features in relation to solution quality and computational cost are discussed. The Chaussee and Pulliam algorithm is used to solve the discretized governing equations. The main objectives of the present work are to perform a comparative study of the four different dissipation models and to assess their cost/accuracy performance characteristics.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARAÇÃO ENTRE VÁRIOS ALGORITMOS DE FATORAÇÃO APROXIMADA NA SOLUÇÃO DAS EQUAÇÕES DE NAVIER-STOKES

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON
AZEVEDO, João Luiz Filgueiras de

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Desenvolvimento de Programas (Software) e Prestação de Serviços em Informática

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Navier-Stokes equations, written in conservative form, are applied to simulate the flowfield in a two-dimensional convergent-divergent transonic nozzle. A finite difference formulation is used to perform the spatial discretization in a generalized coordinate system. The march in pseudo-time is performed by the implicit Euler method to obtain steady state solutions. Three implicit, approximately factored, difference schemes are described and tested in the present work. These include the standard Beam and Warming algorithm, Chaussee and Pulliam´s diagonal version of it, and the Steger and Warming flux vector splitting scheme. Several options for spatial discretization of the split fluxes are studied in connection with the Steger and Warming scheme. The main objectives of the present work are to perform a comparative study of the different algorithms and to assess their cost/accuracy performance characteristics.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARISON AMONG THE FIRST ORDER UPWIND ALGORITHMS OF ROE, OF STEGER AND WARMING, OF VAN LEER AND OF CHAKRAVARTHY AND OSHER IN THE SOLUTION OF THE EULER EQUATIONS IN 2D - THEORY

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: VIII Simpósio de Mecânica Computacional (VIII SIMMEC)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do VIII Simpósio de Mecânica Computacional (VIII SIMMEC)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In the present work, first part of this study, the theories involving the numerical implementation of the flux difference splitting scheme of Roe, of the flux vector splitting schemes of Steger and Warming and of Van Leer, on a finite volume context, and of the flux difference splitting scheme of Chakravarthy and Osher, on a finite difference context, are detailed. The four algorithms are treated using a structured spatial discretization and are first order accurate. First order time integrations like time splitting or Euler explicit are implemented. The Euler equations in conservation form, either in an integral or in a differential approach, in two-dimensions, are solved. The steady state physical problems of the transonic flow along a convergent-divergent nozzle and the supersonic flows along a compression corner and along a ramp are studied and compared with theoretical and experimental results. The numerical results and the analyses of these studies are the subject of the part II of this work (RESULTS). A spatially variable time step procedure is also described and implemented aiming accelerate the convergence of the algorithms to the steady solution. The gains in convergence with this procedure were demonstrated in Maciel.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARISON AMONG THE FIRST ORDER UPWIND ALGORITHMS OF ROE, OF STEGER AND WARMING, OF VAN LEER AND OF CHAKRAVARTHY AND OSHER IN THE SOLUTION OF THE EULER EQUATIONS IN 2D - RESULTS

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do VIII Simpósio de Mecânica Computacional (VIII SIMMEC)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In the present work, second part of this study, the results involving the numerical simulations of the flux difference splitting scheme of Roe, of the flux vector splitting schemes of Steger and Warming and of Van Leer, on a finite volume context, and of the flux difference splitting scheme of Chakravarthy and Osher, on a finite difference context, are described. The four algorithms are treated using a structured spatial discretization and are first order accurate. First order time integrations like time splitting or Euler explicit are implemented. The Euler equations in conservation form, either in an integral or in a differential approach, in two-dimensions, are solved. The steady state physical problems of the transonic flow along a convergent-divergent nozzle and the supersonic flows along a compression corner and along a ramp are studied and compared with theoretical and experimental results. The numerical solutions and the analyses of these studies are the subject of this work. The results have shown that the Steger and Warming scheme predicts the most accurate wall pressure distribution in the nozzle problem, while the Van Leer scheme predicts the most accurate wall pressure distribution in the compression corner and ramp problems. The shock angles in the compression corner and ramp problems are best predicted by the Chakravarthy and Osher scheme. A spatially variable time step procedure is employed aiming accelerate the convergence of the algorithms to the steady solution. The gains in convergence with this procedure were demonstrated in Maciel.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARISON AMONG DIFFERENT ARTIFICIAL DISSIPATION MODELS APPLIED TO A GENERALIZED COORDINATE SYSTEM

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: VIII Simpósio de Mecânica Computacional (VIII SIMMEC)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do VIII Simpósio de Mecânica Computacional (VIII SIMMEC)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work is the second part of the study that aims a comparison among four different artificial dissipation models implemented in the approximated factorization diagonal algorithm of Chaussee and Pulliam. The isotropic scalar linear and nonlinear models of Pulliam and the anisotropic nonlinear scalar and matrix models of Turkel and Vatsa are analyzed. The Euler equations, on a finite difference context and using a generalized coordinate system, are solved in the two-dimensional space. The physical problems of the transonic flow along a convergent-divergent nozzle and the supersonic flow around a blunt body configuration are studied. A spatially variable time step is employed aiming to accelerate the convergence of the diagonal algorithm of Chaussee and Pulliam. The results have demonstrated that the anisotropic nonlinear scalar artificial dissipation model of Turkel and Vatsa predicts the most severe shock at the nozzle?s throat in relation to the other models. The wall pressure distributions obtained by the linear model of Pulliam and the matrix model of Turkel and Vatsa are closer to experimental results. In the blunt body problem, the nonlinear model of Pulliam predicts the most severe pressure peak in the field in relation to the other models. Moreover, the nonlinear model of Pulliam and the nonlinear scalar model of Turkel and Vatsa detect bigger values of Cp, at the configuration nose, than the other models. Finally, the nonlinear model of Pulliam is the most accurate in the prediction of the stagnation pressure in front of the configuration nose. As conclusion, the nonlinear scalar model of Turkel and Vatsa is the most critical in the nozzle problem, although the Pulliam?s linear and the Turkel and Vatsa?s matrix models are more accurate, while the nonlinear model of Pulliam is the most critical and the most accurate in the blunt body problem.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARISON AMONG THE UNSTRUCTURED ALGORITHMS OF FRINK, PARIKH AND PIRZADEH, OF LIOU AND STEFFEN, AND OF RADESPIEL AND KROLL IN THE SOLUTION OF THE EULER EQUATIONS IN 2D - THEORY

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work performs comparisons among the Frink, Parikh and Pirzadeh, the Liou and Steffen and the Radespiel and Kroll algorithms applied to the solution of aeronautical and of aerospace problems, in two-dimensions. The Euler equations in conservative form, employing a finite volume formulation and an unstructured spatial discretization, are solved. The Frink, Parikh and Pirzadeh scheme is a flux difference splitting one and more accurate solutions are expected. On the other hand, the Liou and Steffen and the Radespiel and Kroll schemes are flux vector splitting ones and more robustness properties are expected. The time integration is performed by a Runge-Kutta method. All three schemes are first order accurate in space and second order accurate in time. The steady state physical problems of the transonic flow along a convergent-divergent nozzle, of the supersonic flows along a ramp and around a blunt body and of the ?cold gas? hypersonic flow around a double ellipse are studied. In this paper, the first of this series (THEORY), the theories involving the numerical implementation of these three schemes are developed, while in the second paper of this series (RESULTS), the numerical results obtained with all the three schemes are presented and analyzed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: COMPARISON AMONG THE UNSTRUCTURED ALGORITHMS OF FRINK, PARIKH AND PIRZADEH, OF LIOU AND STEFFEN, AND OF RADESPIEL AND KROLL IN THE SOLUTION OF THE EULER EQUATIONS IN 2D - RESULTS

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work performs comparisons among the Frink, Parikh and Pirzadeh, the Liou and Steffen and the Radespiel and Kroll algorithms applied to the solution of aeronautical and aerospace problems, in two-dimensions. The Euler equations in conservative form, employing a finite volume formulation and an unstructured spatial discretization, are solved. The Frink, Parikh and Pirzadeh scheme is a flux difference splitting one and more accurate solutions are expected. The Liou and Steffen and the Radespiel and Kroll schemes are flux vector splitting ones and more robustness properties are expected. The time integration is performed by a Runge-Kutta method. All three schemes are first order accurate in space and second order accurate in time. The steady state problems of the transonic flow along a convergent-divergent nozzle, the supersonic flows along a ramp and around a blunt body and the ?cold gas? hypersonic flow around a double ellipse are studied. The results have shown that the Frink, Parikh and Pirzadeh scheme presents the most severe pressure fields and the most accurate values of the stagnation pressure in the blunt body and in the double ellipse problems. The Radespiel and Kroll scheme yields the best shock angle value in the ramp problem.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Comparação entre Algoritmos de Separação de Vetores de Fluxo e de Diferenças de Fluxo de Primeira Ordem na Solução das Equações de Euler em Duas Dimensões ? Teoria

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anales del Primer Congreso Argentino de Ingeniería Mecánica (I CAIM)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O presente trabalho estuda esquemas assimétricos (?upwind?) aplicados à solução de problemas aeronáuticos e aeroespaciais. Os algoritmos de Harten, de Frink, Parikh e Pirzadeh, de Liou e Steffen e de Radespiel e Kroll, todos de primeira ordem de precisão espacial, são estudados. Os algoritmos de Harten e de Frink, Parikh e Pirzadeh são do tipo separação de diferenças de fluxo e soluções mais precisas são esperadas. Em contrapartida, os algoritmos de Liou e Steffen e de Radespiel e Kroll são do tipo separação de vetores de fluxo e esquemas mais robustos são esperados. As equações de Euler na forma conservativa, empregando uma formulação de volumes finitos e uma discretização espacial estruturada, no espaço bidimensional, são resolvidas. Um método de separação temporal ou um método de Runge-Kutta de cinco estágios é utilizado para realizar a marcha no tempo dos esquemas numéricos. Os problemas físicos de estado estacionário dos escoamentos transônicos ao longo de um bocal convergente-divergente e em torno de um aerofólio NACA 0012, e do escoamento hipersônico de ?gás frio? em torno de uma configuração de dupla elipse são estudados. Um passo no tempo variável espacialmente é empregado a fim de acelerar o processo de convergência. Este trabalho apresenta a teoria envolvendo a implementação numérica dos algoritmos mencionados. A continuação deste artigo, ?RESULTADOS FINAIS?, apresenta os resultados numéricos obtidos pelos esquemas na simulação dos problemas físicos supracitados. Como conclusão, os esquema de Harten e de Frink, Parikh e Pirzadeh apresentam as soluções mais críticas e mais precisas em relação aos outros esquemas testados.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Comparação entre Algoritmos de Separação de Vetores de Fluxo e de Diferenças de Fluxo de Primeira Ordem na Solução das Equações de Euler em Duas Dimensões ? Resultados Finais

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Primer Congreso Argentino de Ingeniería Mecánica (I CAIM)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anales del Primer Congreso Argentino de Ingeniería Mecánica (I CAIM)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O presente trabalho é a segunda parte do estudo que visa uma comparação entre os esquemas assimétricos (?upwind?) de Harten, de Frink, Parikh e Pirzadeh, de Liou e Steffen e de Radespiel e Kroll aplicados a problemas aeronáuticos e aeroespaciais. Todos os esquemas são de primeira ordem de precisão no espaço. As equações de Euler em forma conservativa, empregando uma formulação de volumes finitos e discretização espacial estruturada, em duas dimensões, são resolvidas. A integração temporal é realizada usando o método de separação temporal, de primeira ordem, ou de Runge-Kutta, de segunda ordem. Os problemas físicos de estado estacionário dos escoamentos transônicos ao longo de um bocal convergente-divergente e em torno de um aerofólio NACA 0012, e do escoamento hipersônico de ?gás frio? em torno de uma configuração de dupla elipse são estudados. Um passo no tempo variável espacialmente é empregado a fim de acelerar o processo de convergência. No problema do bocal, os esquemas de Frink, Parikh e Pirzadeh e de Liou e Steffen detectam ondas de choques mais severas na garganta do que os demais esquemas. No problema do aerofólio, o esquema de Frink, Parikh e Pirzadeh detecta o valor do coeficiente de pressão, Cp, mais severo na onda de choque e também prevê o melhor valor para o coeficiente aerodinâmico de sustentação. No problema da dupla elipse, o esquema de Radespiel e Kroll apresenta o valor mais alto de Cp no nariz da configuração, evidenciando uma solução mais crítica. A pressão de estagnação a frente da configuração é mais bem prevista pelo esquema de Harten. Em todos os problemas, o algoritmo de Harten prevê o campo de pressão mais severo. Como conclusão, os esquema de Harten e de Frink, Parikh e Pirzadeh apresentam as soluções mais críticas e mais precisas em relação aos outros esquemas testados.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Comparação entre Modelos de Turbulência de Duas Equações Aplicados a um Problema Aeroespacial

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anales del Primer Congreso Argentino de Ingeniería Mecánica (I CAIM)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Nide Geraldo do Couto Ramos Fico Júnior
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: FICO JÚNIOR, Nide Geraldo Do Couto Ramos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O presente trabalho estuda modelos de turbulência de duas equações aplicados à solução de um problema aeroespacial em escoamento supersônico. As equações de Navier-Stokes em duas dimensões escritas em forma conservativa, empregando uma formulação de volumes finitos e uma discretização espacial estruturada, são resolvidas. O algoritmo assimétrico (?upwind?) de separação de vetores de fluxo de Van Leer, de primeira ordem de precisão no espaço, é empregado para realizar os experimentos numéricos. A integração temporal é realizada por um método de Runge-Kutta, de segunda ordem de precisão. Turbulência é levada em consideração utilizando dos modelos de turbulência k- de Jacon e Knight e de Kergaravat e Knight. O problema físico de estado estacionário do escoamento supersônico em torno de uma configuração simplificada do Veículo Lançador de Satélites Brasileiro (VLS) é estudado. Neste problema, o pico de pressão no nariz da configuração gerado pelo modelo de Kergaravat e Knight é mais severo do que o respectivo valor obtido com o modelo de Jacon e Knight. O pico do coeficiente de pressão, Cp, no nariz da configuração do VLS é mais intenso para o modelo de Kergaravat e Knight, o que define uma solução mais crítica. O modelo de Kergaravat e Knight prevê perfis de energia cinética turbulenta e de taxa de dissipação turbulenta menos intensos do que os respectivos obtidos com o modelo de Jacon e Knight, produzindo regiões de turbulência menos severas. O coeficiente aerodinâmico de sustentação é mais bem estimado pelo modelo de Jacon e Knight. Os resultados demonstraram que o modelo de Kergaravat e Knight apresenta campos de pressão mais críticos, embora o modelo de Jacon e Knight tenha sido mais preciso na estimativa do coeficiente aerodinâmico de sustentação.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: FIRST ORDER UPWIND ALGORITHMS COUPLED WITH THE BALDWIN AND LOMAX MODEL APPLIED TO TURBULENT FLOW PROBLEMS ? PART II

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Nide Geraldo do Couto Ramos Fico Júnior
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: FICO JÚNIOR, Nide Geraldo Do Couto Ramos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work is the second part of the study that deals with upwind algorithms implemented with the Baldwin and Lomax turbulence algebraic model applied to the solution of transonic and ?cold gas? hypersonic problems. The Harten and the Radespiel and Kroll algorithms, both first order accurate in space, are studied. The Navier-Stokes equations written in conservative form, employing a finite volume formulation and a structured spatial discretization, in two-dimensions, are solved. The steady state physical problems of the transonic flow along a convergent-divergent nozzle and the ?cold gas? hypersonic flow around a double ellipse configuration are studied. Results are compared with experimental or theoretical solutions. The results have shown good agreement between the algorithms tested. In the nozzle problem, the Harten scheme predicts a more severe shock at the throat than the Radespiel and Kroll scheme, as well closer wall pressure distribution to experimental results, for both laminar and turbulent cases. In the double ellipse case, the Radespiel and Kroll scheme presented more severe pressure field and better prediction of the stagnation pressure than the Harten scheme, again to both laminar and turbulent cases.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Analysis of Convergence Acceleration Techniques Used in Unstructured Algorithms in the Solution of Aerospace Problems ? Part II

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XII Brazilian Congress of Thermal Engineering and Sciences (XII ENCIT)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the XII Brazilian Congress of Thermal Engineering and Sciences (XII ENCIT)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This work is the second part of the study that deals with convergence acceleration techniques applied to the solution of steady state problems. Techniques like spatially variable time step, implicit residual smoothing, enthalpy damping and increase of the CFL number during iterative process are studied. The Jameson and Mavriplis explicit algorithm, with symmetrical spatial discretization and the artificial dissipation operator of Mavriplis, is implemented to perform the two-dimensional numerical experiments. This scheme is second order accurate in space. The Euler equations in conservative form, employing a finite volume formulation and an unstructured spatial discretization, are solved. The techniques are studied and compared with themselves in the solution of the physical problem of the supersonic flow around a blunt body, with zero attack angle. The employed time march is the Runge-Kutta method of five stages and second order. The results have shown that the best studied techniques were the spatially variable time step and the implicit residual smoothing, having good convergence gains, moderate computational costs and more regular behavior. These techniques also presented good behavior in the first paper of this series, where the enthalpy damping was the best. An analysis of the computational performances of the techniques is accomplished (cost, maximum CFL number and iterations to convergence).

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: EXPLICIT AND IMPLICIT TVD AND ENO HIGH RESOLUTION ALGORITHMS APPLIED TO THE EULER AND NAVIER-STOKES EQUATIONS IN THREE-DIMENSIONS ? RESULTS

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XX International Congress of Mechanical Engineering (XX COBEM)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the XX International Congress of Mechanical Engineering (XX COBEM)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In the present work, the Harten and Osher TVD/ENO and the Yee TVD symmetric schemes are implemented, on a finite volume context and using a structured spatial discretization, to solve the Euler and the laminar Navier-Stokes equations in the three-dimensional space. The Harten and Osher TVD/ENO schemes are flux difference splitting type, whereas the Yee TVD scheme is a symmetric one, which incorporates TVD properties due to the appropriated definition of a limited dissipation function. All three schemes are second order accurate in space. An implicit formulation is employed to all schemes in the solution of the Euler equations. The flux difference splitting schemes employ approximate factorizations in Linearized Nonconservative Implicit LNI form, whereas the symmetric scheme employs approximate factorization in ADI form. A spatially variable time step procedure is also implemented aiming to accelerate the convergence of the algorithms to the steady solution. The gains in convergence with this procedure were demonstrated in Maciel. The schemes are applied to the solution of the physical problems of the transonic flow along a convergent-divergent nozzle and of the supersonic flow along a compression corner in the inviscid case, whereas the laminar case studies a particular ramp problem. The results have demonstrated that the most accurate results are obtained with the Harten and Osher ENO and Yee TVD VL and Min1 schemes. This paper is the second part of this work, RESULTS, considering the presentation of the inviscid and laminar viscous results.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: EXTENSION OF THE UNSTRUCTURED ALGORITHMS OF LIOU AND STEFFEN JR. AND OF RADESPIEL AND KROLL TO SECOND ORDER ACCURACY EMPLOYING LINEAR RECONSTRUCTION AND APPLICATION TO THE EULER EQUATIONS IN 2D - THEORY

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XX International Congress of Mechanical Engineering (XX COBEM)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the XX International Congress of Mechanical Engineering (XX COBEM)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In the present work, the Liou and Steffen Jr. and the Radespiel and Kroll schemes are implemented, on a finite volume context and using an upwind and unstructured spatial discretization, to solve the Euler equations in the two-dimensional space. Both schemes are flux vector splitting ones. These schemes are implemented in their second order accuracy versions employing the reconstruction linear method of Barth and Jespersen and their results are compared with their first order accuracy versions and with theoretical results. Five nonlinear flux limiters are studied: Barth and Jespersen (minmod like), Van Leer, Van Albada, Superbee and -limiter. The time integration uses a Runge-Kutta method of five stages and is second order accurate. Both algorithms are accelerated to the steady state solution using a spatially variable time step procedure. This technique has proved excellent gains in terms of convergence ratio as reported in Maciel. The algorithms are applied to the solution of the steady state physical problem of the supersonic flow along a compression corner. In this paper, the first of this series (THEORY), the theories involving the numerical implementation of the two schemes to first order accuracy and later the extension to second order accuracy are developed, whereas in the second paper of this series (RESULTS), the numerical solutions obtained with both schemes, in their first and second order accuracies, are presented and analyzed. The results have shown that the Radespiel and Kroll scheme using Barth and Jespersen, Van Leer, Van Albada and Superbee nonlinear limiters presents the most accurate values to the shock angle of the oblique shock wave generated at the compression corner.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: EXTENSION OF THE UNSTRUCTURED ALGORITHMS OF LIOU AND STEFFEN JR. AND OF RADESPIEL AND KROLL TO SECOND ORDER ACCURACY EMPLOYING LINEAR RECONSTRUCTION AND APPLICATION TO THE EULER EQUATIONS IN 2D - RESULTS

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In the present work, the Liou and Steffen Jr. and the Radespiel and Kroll schemes are implemented, on a finite volume context and using an upwind and unstructured spatial discretization, to solve the Euler equations in the two-dimensional space. DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 26th International Congress of the Aeronautical Sciences (26th ICAS)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work performs comparisons between the Yee, Warming and Harten and the Hughson and Beran algorithms in the solution of inviscid and laminar and turbulent viscous flows in three-dimensions. The Euler and the Navier-Stokes equations, on a finite volume context and using a structured spatial discretization, are solved. The algorithms are flux difference splitting type and a dimensional splitting method is used to perform time integration. The physical problem of the supersonic flow along a ramp is studied. Turbulence is taking into account considering two turbulence models, namely: the Cebeci and Smith and the Baldwin and Lomax algebraic ones. The results have demonstrated that the Hughson and Beran scheme yields more severe pressure fields, while the Yee, Warming and Harten scheme presents more accurate results.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Explicit and Implicit Solutions of First Order Algorithms Applied to the Euler Equations in Two-Dimensions ? Part I ? Explicit Formulations
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Explicit and Implicit Solutions of First Order Algorithms Applied to the Euler Equations in Two-Dimensions ? Part I ? Explicit Formulations

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do IX Simpósio de Mecânica Computacional (IX SIMMEC)

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MACIEL, Edisson Sávio de Góes;DE GÓES MACIEL, EDISSON SÁVIO;MACIEL, EDISSON

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work, the first part of this study, the Roe, the Steger and Warming, the Van Leer, the Chakravarthy and Osher, the Harten, the MacCormack, the Frink, Parikh and Pirzadeh, the Liou and Steffen Jr. and the Radespiel and Kroll first order schemes are implemented employing an implicit formulation to solve the Euler equations in the two-dimensional space. These schemes are implemented according to a finite volume formulation and using a structured spatial discretization. The Roe, the Chakravarthy and Osher, the Harten and the Frink, Parikh and Pirzadeh schemes are flux difference splitting ones, whereas the others are flux vector splitting schemes. The implicit schemes employ an ADI (?Alternating Direct Implicit?) approximate factorization or Symmetric Line Gauss-Seidel to solve implicitly the Euler equations. Explicit and implicit results are compared, as also the computational costs, trying to emphasize the advantages and disadvantages of each formulation. The schemes are accelerated to the steady state solution using a spatially variable time step, which has demonstrated effective gains in terms of convergence rate according to Maciel. The algorithms are applied to the solution of the physical problem of the moderate supersonic flow along a compression corner. The results have demonstrated that the most accurate solutions are obtained with the Harten first order scheme, when implemented in its explicit version. The best wall pressure distribution is obtained by the Radespiel and Kroll first order scheme, in both explicit and implicit cases. The implicit formulation of these schemes, the numerical results and the analyses of this study are the subjects of the part II of this work (IMPLICIT FORMULATIONS AND RESULTS).
